#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Family Coalition Party candidate Ray Scott , Algoma-Manitoulin
#Text=Tuesday , October 2 , 2007
#Text=is running for the Family Coalition Party in the Ontario provincial election , in the Algoma-Manitoulin riding .
#Text=Wikinews ' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I first became involved in politics because of my pro-life beliefs .
#Text=I had no candidate that I could vote for that truly believed in the sanctity of human life .
#Text=When I found the Family Coalition Party , and saw a well-rounded party platform , I supported the FCP .
#Text=When there was no candidate in my area , I felt conscience-bound to run .
#Text=I am running in Algoma-Manitoulin because we need pro-lifers in government and none of the other candidates can offer that .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=In terms of elections , I have run twice before .
#Text=In my professional life , as a public school teacher , I have vast experience in moving agendas forward and resolving conflicts .
#Text=As a pro-life , and union activist , I frequently engage in the political process and understand how decisions are made , and how to positively influence those processes .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ?
#Text=Why ?
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=The incumbent Liberal candidate has held the riding for 20 years and has a very strong campaign organization .
#Text=The NDP candidate has the best set of promises , though I do n’t think they can be paid for .
#Text=I am the best candidate because my party ’s policy on healthcare realistically addresses the primary needs of Ontarians .
#Text=The health policy for the Family Coalition Party is called “ Medical Savings Accounts ” .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=Issue #1 : Healthcare
#Text=The Family Coalition Party proposes a system of Medical Savings Accounts ( MSAs ) .
#Text=Basically , imagine your health card as a debit card .
#Text=The government puts $ 2000 in your own MSA .
#Text=Every time you visit the doctor or access health services , you present your health card and the cost of service is withdrawn from your MSA .
#Text=You may only spend that money on healthcare .
#Text=If you deplete your account , there is a user-pay portion roughly equivalent to the Liberal Health Tax .
#Text=After that , government run catastrophic healthcare insurance kicks in , similar to OHIP .
